fields.description:

It looks like there a discrepancy with the 24 hr timer we show on KBs and Docs about the Jira Backup Manager

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Attach Screenshot dialog is cropped on small screens.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Have a screenshot and copy/paste it into an issue using keyboard shortcuts (CMD/CTRL + C, CTRL/CMD + V)

h3. Expected Results
The dialog *Attach Screenshot* appears and then you can upload the file on the issue.
 !attach-screenshot.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
If your screen is too small or it's resized, the dialog does not resize accordingly, therefore the buttons to cancel/upload are cropped:
 !attach-cropped.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Use the *browse* option in the Attachments section of the issue.
 !attachments.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The Attach Screenshot dialog is cropped on small screens

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Importing from Cloud to an empty Server instance fails producing an NullPointerException
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export data from a cloud instance
 # Set up or access a test Server instance (7.6.2 is fine to reproduce)
 # Attempt to import the data

h3. Expected Results

The import works without problems
h3. Actual Results

The import stops at 90% and then fails producing an error. Tables appear to be partially generated during the process, so a new import requires deleting and recreating the application DB beforehand. If the import was made using the Setup Wizard during a fresh installation, the UI does not display any errors but users won't be able to login afterwards.

The below exception is thrown in the catalina.log file:
{noformat}
2018-01-03 16:49:56,678 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR admin 1009x287x1 6z8rud 172.21.44.34 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.getTypeInfo(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:111)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.toDdlField(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:93)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.toDdlTable(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.create(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:70)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsTableCreator.create(ActiveObjectsTableCreator.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.TableDefinitionImporter.doImportNode(TableDefinitionImporter.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.AbstractImporter.importNode(AbstractImporter.java:44)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.DbImporter.importData(DbImporter.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsBackup.restore(ActiveObjectsBackup.java:151)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.restoreActiveObjects(.java:584)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:758)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:331)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:133)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Manually removing all data relating to AO_575BF5 from activeobjects.xml allows the import to complete successfully:
 # Extract the contents of the backup (zip) file.
 # Using your preferred text editor, open the file _activeobjects.xml._
 # Look and delete all the tags containing a reference to the table _AO_575BF5._ You need to remove each complete entry related to it (see my example [^image-2018-01-04-19-26-39-993.png]. The example is using a different table, but the principle is the same. The XML file might appear in a format difficult to read, so you might want to do the following:
 ** For *Windows Users:* use a text editor that can format the XML to be humanly easier to read and edit, in my case I used Notepad++ with the [XML Tools plugin|https://sourceforge.net/projects/npp-plugins/files/XML%20Tools/], and used the function 'Pretty print' from the XML Plugin (see my example [^image-2018-01-04-19-12-05-438.png]).
 ** For *Unix based OS*, another option to format the XML file is with the command:
{noformat}
xmllint --format activeobjects.xml > activeobjects_formatted.xml
{noformat}

 *** (i) You will need to rename the _activeobjects_formatted.xml_ back to _activeobjects.xml_ before zipping them.
 # Once all the entries related to the table _AO_575BF5_ have been removed, save the file and create a new zip file using the newly saved _activeobjects.xml_ and the original entities.xml.
 # Attempt the Restore System again.
fields.summary: Importing from Cloud to an empty Server instance fails producing an NullPointerException

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Users want the ability to have dev and staging environments that they can use for testing and be able to push changes from each other

h3. Suggested Solution

Have dev/staging environments that can push changes between each other

h3. Why this is important

Easily test changes on a dev environment to make sure everything functions properly before making the same changes on production instances
 
h3. Workaround 

Set up a new JIRA trial instance and export/import backups from one instance to another for testing
fields.summary: As an administrator I'd like the ability to have a Staging environment and sync it easily with my production site

fields.description:
When releasing a version from the Project Overview > Releases, you have the option to set the Release Date. When your language is set to French, the date picker for the Release Date is corrupted, as per this screenshot: 
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-09 at 1.25.36 PM.png|thumbnail! 
As per above, all the values are undefined.

This problem does not happen if you are releasing the version when your language is set to English (US or UK).

This is the only date picker that is affected, the fields in other screens work fine in all languages (e.g. editing issue date fields isn't affected)
fields.summary: Cannot set version release date due to corrupted date picker when language is set to French

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Can't access project's People. The page doesn't return anything and no error shown in UI. On browser's console, error is thrown:
{noformat} 
Uncaught (in promise) Error: Failed to obtain the project context for the page
    at users-and-roles.a5cba31a4a8076a430b4.5.js:1
    at <anonymous>
{noformat}

Note: this happens when the user who is trying to load the People page doesn't have browse Project Permissions

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Navigate to a project
# Click *People*

h2. Expected Result
The People(users and roles) should display

h2. Current Result
The page doesn't load and no error shown in UI.

h2. Workaround

Grant Browse Project permission in the Permission scheme to a Single User or a group.
fields.summary: Can't access project's People

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition: 
Currently it's not possible to set different 'default' values for issue security level according to the user/group. For example, when users from group "External" create an issue, the default security level in create issue screen be selected as "External Level". And if a user from "Internal" group is creating an issue, the default security level be chosen as "Internal Level" in the security level field.

h3. Suggested Solution: 
Ability to set multiple 'default' value for issue security level based on the user's group membership.

h3. Why this is important
This functionality provides more efficiency and ease for managing issue's security and restriction.
fields.summary: Ability to set different default values for issue security level based on the user who's creating issue

fields.description:
We have Jira's Slack integration configured to post links to tickets whenever someone mentions them in chat, which is really useful in general. Unfortunately, we'll often have conversations like this:

*person 1:* I'm going to do FOO-60 this way
*Jira:* FOO-60: blah blah blah
*person 2:* Yeah, that's how I implemented FOO-60, FOO-61 seems pretty similar
*Jira:* FOO-60: blah blah blah
*Jira:* FOO-61: blah blah blah
*person 1:* makes sense, although FOO-61 is a little different
*Jira:* FOO-61: blah blah blah

Jira's Slack integration would be a lot less noisy while still being useful if it could avoid posting links to tickets if it's already posted a link to the same ticket in the same channel within the last few minutes, or perhaps within the last few dozen or so messages in that channel.
fields.summary: Slack integration should have a timeout before mentioning the same issue twice in the same channel

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In IE 11 when viewing issues from a project, the entire screen grey's out rendering it inoperable. This is only happening on a few instances, in both new JIRA experience and older UI.

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to instance using IE 11
# Click on any project from the project menu
# Click view issues.

h3. Expected Results
Ability to click on issues, and scroll through issues shown.

h3. Actual Results
Screen is greyed out and user is unable to perform any operations.
 
h3.Workaround
User another browser such as Chrome or Firefox.
fields.summary: IE 11 Issues greyed out, unable to scroll or work issues.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Group cannot be removed from a role when it has been deleted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group.
# Add the group to a role.
# Delete the group.

# Click "Remove" and confirm on the "People" tab where the group is associated with a role.

h3. Expected Results

The group to role association is successfully deleted.

h3. Actual Results

It says that the group could not be found and the association remains.
 !error.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

# Re-create the group.
# Delete the association to the role.
# Delete the group.

h3. Notes

Although the delete message says that the group information will remain on the instance, the user should be able to delete it afterward. !message.png|thumbnail! 

The error message is bugged on the new UI:
 !uierr.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Deleted Group cannot be removed from a Role

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Audit Log retention period not being honored

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set your Audit Log settings to retain data for 1, 3 or 6 months.
 !audit-settings.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Only data up to the specified period should be retained, up to 6 months.

h3. Actual Results
Jira is holding data for more than one year, depending on the instance.

h3. Notes
The maximum retention period on audit log should be *6 months*. 
However, this is not mentioned in the article [Auditing in Jira applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/auditing-in-jira-applications-818578846.html]

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Audit Log retention period is not being honoured

fields.description:
h3. Description

As a user, I would like to suggest a change on the behaviour of the *Home* icon that is available on the search screen.

Currently, on the new JIRA UI, when performing a search via the search panel, the JIRA icon on the top-left corner becomes nonfunctional, not allowing a user to return to the home page

This behavior is illustrated on the following video: 

* https://www.screencast.com/t/j8JwWw0R0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the search via the search panel or by using the feature shortcut: */* 
 # Try to click on the icon on the top-left corner:  
!home icon.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The icon doesn't behaves as it does in other screens.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition: 

* When using a custom field type *select list (single choice)* it happens that with the time we don't want to consider anymore one of the choices. 
* So, we don't want to delete the choice because it was already used in the past in old issues , simultaneously, we don't want users in the future to use this same choice.
* Currently, if an option from a custom field is removed, JIRA removes that option for all existing issues that have it (closed as well).
* This may be considerer a lack of data integrity. We should be able to modify field choices for future issues without "breaking" the past issues.

h3. Suggested Solution: 

* Adding a boolean column called *Active* to the custom field table.
* Next to the custom field on the admin screen would be an option to disable the option. If disabled, the boolean field would change from 1 to 0. If 0, that option would simply not show up as a future available option, but be valid for all issues that already have it.


h3. Why this is important

* This is important since the old issues can be used for statistics or for generating reports.
* This is a required feature to ensure data is retained for legal purposes and the user interface is not populated with old data. 

 
h3. Workaround 

* to modify the choice name from old_name to: 
** old_name(don't use retired)
** or old_name(inactive)
** or old_name(deprecated)

* So in summary modifying the name to tell that this choice is not valid anymore but do not lose the first meaning.
fields.summary: I want to archive a custom field choice

fields.description:
Problem:

After creating a custom field as "Select List (single choice)", you can't change it to "Select List (multiple choices)"

Suggestion:

Being similar, there should be an option to transform one type to another, as your needs might change, without having to create a new custom field and set it up from scratch.
fields.summary: Ability to change a custom field type from "Select List (single choice)" to "Select List (multiple choices)"

Quick Filter not appearing in Business boards when using JIRA iOS App

# In JIRA iOS App, these quick filters are not appearing.

h2. Expected Result
It should have the quick filters in the board.

h2. Current Result
The quick filters are not appearing.
fields.summary: Quick Filter not showing in Business boards in iOS App

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 Back in Jira's old experience, *Quick search* (shortcut '/') allowed users to easily search for text (e.g. by pressing '/' and typing any word, you would be redirected to the Issue search with the JQL text ~ <word>). This was a good option for users who wanted to access search and create more complex queries from a simple text search. 

In Jira's new experience, quick search automatically searches for the word written but does not take the user to the Issue search page. Instead, if no results are found and the user presses *ENTER*, Jira will redirect to a JQL search for {{ORDER BY lastViewed DESC}}

h3. Environment
 * Behavior observed in Jira's new experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Jira in its new experience
# Press '/' or click the magnifying glass button to open *Quick search*
# Type any text desired and wait until the search is performed
# Press ENTER afterwards and notice that Jira will automatically redirect you to the Issue search page, but returning all existing issues

h3. Expected Results
 * Previously, Jira would automatically run the search "text ~ <text>"

h3. Actual Results
 * Jira redirects to a JQL returning all existing issues
  !Screen Shot 2018-01-05 at 13.10.55.png|thumbnail!
  !Screen Shot 2018-01-05 at 13.11.01.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
 * There is no workaround
fields.summary: Quick Search in New Jira Experience does not work as it used to

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the new Jira layout, if you use the quick search shortcut "/" and press Enter without searching for anything, you will open the latest viewed issue.
However, this is not the behavior in the old layout. Pressing "/" and Enter will open the issue search instead open the latest issue if you are using the old Jira UI.

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the quick search shortcut in the new Jira UI to open the issue search if no result is selected.

h3. Why this is important
This is important to keep the consistency of the shortcut as it was used in the old UI.
 
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Change the behavior of the quick search shortcut

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Most add-ons that are integrated into the issue details view won't load when you view an issue from the side panel. The behaviour is the same for all add-ons for any type of project in Jira.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install an addon on your Jira (in this example tempo timesheets was used)
 # Go to your project's issues panel and select a random issue to view (if it doesn't happen on the first try select another random issue) 

h3. Expected Results

On the side view, the issue details will appear along with its fields and the add-on integrated amongst them.

!_WB-16__There_s_lots_more_magic____-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The add-on will not load, it takes a few seconds to attempt to load and then fails with this message:
{noformat}
 App is not responding. Wait or cancel?{noformat}
h3. !_WB-16__There_s_lots_more_magic____-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

There is no actual workaround besides refreshing the page or clicking again on the issue, then the issue will reload with the add-ons loaded.
fields.summary: App is not responding

h3. Notes

Most imports that experience this issue seem to be migrating from Server to Cloud.
h3. Workaround

Below steps fixed the issue for different customers:
 # Unzip the backup file
 # Edit the file named entities.xml and change the 'OSPropertyEntry id="X"' and 'OSPropertyString id="X"' where X equals to the ID pointed in the error, to an unused id, like 9999 for example.
 # Re-zip the file (make sure you maintain the original structure or the import will fail)
 # Import the zip file from previous step into JIRA
fields.summary: JIRA backup imports are failing returning PSQLException exception

fields.description:
When a user is added to the People tab in Jira Service Desk Cloud, the resulting confirmation window is blocked from view by the sidebar, regardless of window width. Sidebar cannot be minimized or hidden to read the confirmation window. 

!Screen Shot 2018-01-04 at 10.58.48 AM.png|thumbnail!  

!Screen Shot 2018-01-04 at 10.58.56 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Confirmation window when adding users is blocked from view with ADG3

fields.description:
Currently if a user is deleted or deactivated with issues, they are unable to send in a request to an open email handler with a default reported when reactivated.  This is due to licensing and the deactivated user still having issues assigned.

Customers would like to be able to reactivate an account with no application access and have them be able to create issues without having a license to a mail handler with a default reporter.
fields.summary: Allow previously deactivated or deleted users to be reactivated and send email to create issues or comments.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

 The Link Issue dialogue default focus when the dialogue opens is on its own menu item which is redundant.

h3. Suggested Solution

I suggest that the focus should be on the issue key field instead.
It's more natural to open the dialogue with the shortcut key, and then immediately type the issue key you want to link

h3. Workaround

Press [tab] four times to move the field without the mouse.
fields.summary: Default focus in Issue Link window should be the issue key field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a new context is added to the Flagged Custom Field, on your Jira board you cannot flag an issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Custom Fields and click on configure for the field ''Flagged''.
 # Add a new context and apply it to the concerned project in JIRA.
 # Go to that project's board
 # Right-click on any issue and select ''Add a Flag''

!Configure_Custom_Field__Flagged_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

The issue is now flagged and has a flag icon next to the issue type icon.
 !KPT_board_-_Agile_Board_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The issue isn't flag and you get an error message:
Invalid value '10000' passed for customfield 'Flagged'.
 !KPT_board_-_Agile_Board_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

If no context is added, you can flag an issue with no trouble.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround. Simply avoid adding any additional contexts to the field and use the default one.
fields.summary: Context Flagged custom field causes error when Flagging issue on Board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition 
Currently user is able to rename a sprint, and name it same as an existing sprint.

h3. Why this is important?
This cause some confusion while you are working with the board and backlog, as you can see multiple sprints with exactly same name.

h3. Suggested solution
* Prevent users from naming a sprint same as an existing sprint, or
* Enable admin to configure this, and choose if users should be able to name a sprint same as an existing sprint
fields.summary: Ability to prevent user to rename a sprint with the same name as an existing sprint

fields.description: It would be great to have the ability to edit the columns in the "Projects > View all projects" page. In this particular case, I would like to be able to add a column for Description (which is edited in the Project settings). My company has many projects, and new employees - and even existing employees - often have trouble determining which project to create an issue under. I can add a brief description to each project and have that column presented in the page described above, which would provide some much-needed guidance. Unfortunately, this functionality does not seem to be native to JIRA nor available with a plugin. Thank you.
fields.summary: Project Descriptions

fields.description:
When a user that is *not* a *Jira Administrator* but has the *Administer Project* project makes a simple change on the *Project Details* page in the project's settings, the *Project Category* is removed inadvertently.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create/Access a project that has a *Category* set
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-03 at 17.02.38.png|thumbnail! 
# With an user with the *Administer Project* (but not a Jira Administrator), click on *Save Details* in the *Project Details* page
# The *project category* will be removed automatically
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-03 at 17.03.28.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* The *project category* is not affected

h3. Actual Results
* The *project category* is removed

h3. Workaround
* Ask an user with the *Jira Administrator* permission to make the change
fields.summary: Project losing Category after modifying Project Details.

fields.description:
*Problem* 

On a Jira issue, whenever you try to link it to a Confluence page using it's tiny URLs (like,  https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/x/FoOoO/) the tool is not able to parse it causing an error  !image-2018-01-03-15-44-06-534.png|thumbnail! This doesn't seems like a bug, but an inability of the "linker" tool to parse these links

*Why this is important?*

The usage of TinyURLs in Confluence is raising, people frequently copy them from e-mail, it would be good for not needing to fetch the complete URL just for linking on Jira issues.

*Suggested solution*

Enable the usage of TinyURLs when linking a Confluence Page in a Jira issue.
fields.summary: Enable usage of Confluence's tiny URL for linking pages in Jira issues.

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*
The user needs to hide/show fields for selected users. The system works hiding/showing the fields for all of the users/customers.

*Suggested Solution:*
Allow the users to have the option to manage the fields (hide/show) for selected users/customers.

Example: users on the group XY can see the fields. Other users cannot.

*Workaround:*
—
fields.summary: Hide/Show Fields based on permission

fields.description:
h3.Summary
Since the latest upgrade of JIRA, the icons are no longer showing next to the issue summary.

h3.Actual results in the new UI
!Screen Shot 2018-01-03 at 14.27.32.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Expected results
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-03 at 14.27.09.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Project icons not showing next to the issue summary in the new UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Shared filters are breaking if the user doesn't have permission to access one of the projects in the query

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a shared filter with similar JQL: *project in (PROJECT 1, PROJECT 2)*
# Have a *User A* who have access to *PROJECT 1* but not to *PROJECT 2* and a *User B* who have access to both projects.

h3. Expected Results
Both users access the filter without errors, but the *User A* will get only the pertinent results, issues from *PROJECT 1*.

h3. Actual Results
The *User A* will get an error while accessing the filter, similar to the one below:
{code}
A value with ID '10018' does not exist for the field 'project'.
{code}
And the query for this user will appear as *project in (PROJECT 1, 10018)*
 
h3. Notes
- This bug has similar implications of the feature request to allow partial results, the [JRACLOUD-40245|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40245].
- It's important to notice that the results appear correctly if a *Filter Subscription* is set. In the above-mentioned scenario with a filter subscription, the *User A* will receive the results excluding the project he/she does not have permission to browse. However, if the user clicks on the link in the email to access Jira, will receive the same error as accessing the filter directly.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Shared filters are breaking if the user don't have permission to access one of the projects in the query

fields.description: It'd be nice to have a report to show how much time an issue spent on each project when it's moved from one project to another.
fields.summary: Add a report to show how much time an issue spent on each project

fields.description:
Problem
In Jira mobile app is not possible to change the notification sound.

Suggestion
Having the possibility to change the JIRA mobile app notification sound would be useful so we can identify when tickets are updated just by sound.
fields.summary: Change notification sound in JIRA mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While on a project board, when typing an issue number into the search bar and pressing enter, you will not be directed to the issue.
h3. Environment (Optional - If Applicable)
 * New UI

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 
 # Go to a board.  !image-2018-01-03-21-26-16-334.png|thumbnail!
 # Click the magnifying glass icon.  !image-2018-01-03-21-27-45-647.png|thumbnail!
 # Enter a number for an issue (example: 200)
 # Press enter

h3. Expected Results

The user will be directed to the issue within the project similarly to the old UI behavior when the user performs an issue number search in the top right search box. 
h3. Actual Results

The user will be directed to the first issue returned from the search result based on the content of the issue and not the issue's number
h3. Workaround

Works on as expected on the old UI.
 * Change back to the previous UI by:

 # Go to the user profile icon
 # Select the "Turn off for now" option
fields.summary: Searching issue number in search bar and pressing enter does not send to issue (In the New UI)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user is mentioned in the comment during issue transition, duplicated email notifications will be sent to the user. 

JIRA will generate one mentioned notification for each action performed:
* If during issue transition, the user is mentioned in the comment - JIRA generates two mentioned email notifications:
* If during issue transition, the user is mentioned in the comment and issue assignee updated - JIRA generates three mentioned email notifications

One of the notification will be generated based on the mentioned user's role in the issue:
* If the mentioned user is watcher/assignee - the notification will be:
{code:java}
<user-who-triggered-the-action> commented on <issue-key>
{code}
* If the mentioned user is not watcher/assignee - the notification will be:
{code:java}
<user-who-triggered-the-action> mentioned you on <issue-key>
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new notification scheme as following:
 !Test Notification Scheme.png|thumbnail! 
# Associate the created notification scheme to a project
# Add a screen (which contains the assignee field) to a transition within the workflow for project in previous step
# Create a new issue in this project
# Perform the transition (for which the screen is added) and in the transition's screen add a comment mentioning someone
# Perform the previous step again, and this time, during transition update the issue assignee (assign/re-assign)

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should generate only one mentioned notification

h3. Actual Results
For step #5 (Steps to Reproduce) JIRA generates and sends two mentioned notification to the mentioned user
For step #6 (Steps to Reproduce) JIRA generates and sends three mentioned notification to the mentioned user
fields.summary: JIRA sends duplicated mentioned notifications when a user is mentioned during issue transition

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The people page keeps loading indefinitely. Whenever customers click on the people in project settings, the page keeps loading indefinitely
h3. Customer Impact

No one has access to add users or group to the project roles 
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Go to Site
 # Click on any project
 # Click on *Project settings*
 # Click *People*

h3. Expected Result

A page showing people and their roles appear
h3. Actual results

The page is showing without the people on it

!Screen Shot 2018-01-03 at 10.43.10.png|thumbnail!

Console shows the errors

!Screen Shot 2018-01-03 at 10.44.57.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

currently none
fields.summary: People page loading indefinitely

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a reporter email contains capital letters, searching (Find related issues) based on the field Domain of Reporter would not return the issues reported by the reporter.

h3. Customer Impact
* The search result is not accurate/reliable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a set of users with capital letters in the email address
# Add "Domain of reporter" field to the issues
# Click "Find related issues" to get the issues that reported by the same domain

h3. Expected Results
* All issues reported by the users from the target domains are showing

h3. Actual Results
* Some issues are missing

h3.Workaround
Update the email address to all lower case.
* If the reporter is a Portal-only account, no workaround due to [JSDCLOUD-5830|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-5830] and [JSDCLOUD-4346|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4346].
fields.summary: Domain of reporter does not search for emails with capital letters

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When configuring a webhook with a JQL filter, the webhook will not be fired for the *issue_deleted* event.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an webhook specifying a JQL filter - https://yourinstance.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/webhooks
#* E.g.: 
#** JQL: {{project = <PROJECTKEY>}}
#** Issue: created, updated, deleted
#**  !testing delete.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The webhook should be fired when an issue that matches the JQL is deleted 

h3. Actual Results
For *issue_created* and *issue_updated*, the webhook will be fired correctly. However, If you delete an issue, the webhook will not be triggered and the payload will not be received by the endpoint.
fields.summary: Webhooks setup using a JQL filter aren't being fired when the issue_deleted event occurs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The focus in the search field is lost when you uncheck an option while editing a search.
The problem occurs on any of the options like Project, Type, Status or Assignee.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Issue search, and click on any of the attributes, for example, Status, and check one of them.
# Perform your search and click on the attribute again to uncheck it.

h3. Expected Results
The focus goes back to the search box of the attribute you have opened.
!focus-on.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The focus is lost, therefore if you start typing you can inadvertently trigger any keyboard shortcut.
!no-focus.png|thumbnail! 
In order to use the search box, you must click to reestablish the focus.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Focus in the input field is lost after certain conditions

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*
There is no way to restore workflows after it has been deleted.

*Suggested Solution:*
A feature that allows users to restore workflows after its deletion.

*Workaround:*
Create a copy of the workflow as a backup.
fields.summary: Backup of Workflow

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When in Settings editing area, the left navigation menu resets to the Dashboards rather than stay in Settings area.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the first Jira's Dashboard page go to the left navigation menu.
 # Click on 'Settings'
 # Then Click on 'Issues'
 # Choose one option. Eg. 'Screens'
 # On View Screens page, click 'Configure' next to any Screen listed to view the 'Configure Screen' page
 # Note that the navigation menu in the left panel is reset to the first stage(Dashboard) rather than stay in 'Screen' context.

h3. Expected Results

 The user should be able to still in the same context it is working in.

!expected-behavior.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

When accessing some of the options in the menu, after entering in the option, the menu is reset to the first stage and with the current behaviour, the customer has to click Dashboards -->Settings --> Issues, every time in order to continue working on fields and issues.

!jira_leftnav.PNG|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Click '.' and type the area you want to access. Eg. 'Screens'
fields.summary: Left navigation menu resets to Dashboards when editing Settings
Left navigate panel resets to Dashboards when editing
Left navigate panel resets to Dashboards when editing

fields.description:
When a image is add and then commented on a issue, the notification in the email doesn't show the image.

Reproduce:
Add an image to the issue and then comment it.
The notification in the email will show something like the below image.

 !Email Notifcation.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Emails don't show thumbnail images for attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When editing an issue that is long enough to have a scrollbar, clicking CTRL+Z works (i.e. the recent change is undone), but the cursor is automatically moved/scrolled to the end of the field text.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a Jira issue.
 # Add a description (with a long paragraph).
 # Edit the description.
 # In the first line of the description, type something. Then, undo (ctrl+z). 

h3. Expected Results

The user should still be on the same line of the paragraph where the change was made.
h3. Actual Results 

The cursor will automatically move to the end of the field (at the last line of the paragraph). The user has to manually scroll up back to the top of the paragraph to the line where the change was made.
h3. Notes (Optional - If Necessary)

Reproducible in the comment field as well
h3. Workaround

- Non
fields.summary: Undo (Ctrl+z) in text field causes field to jump to the end of the field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User has noticed a number of corrections to be made on the general JIRA Project page and content mostly regarding to the German language Deutsch (Deutschland) translation of the JIRA description.
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on Project navigation tab > the "Create Project" button shows in English
 # !first_pov.png|width=840,height=238!
 # On the same page, when scrolling to the bottom, the "Prev" and "Next" pagination button also remains in English.

h3. Expected Results

To be able to read the correct translation of the "Create Project, "Prev", "Next" in the German language
h3. Actual Results

Failure to translate the content into the German Language
h3. Workaround
None available currently, as all form of navigation from the search bar, direct URL, project navigation leads back to the same Reports tab as last accessed page in a project.

fields.description:
It's currently possible to add a catch email address in Jira's mail handler that allows Jira to process emails only if a specific recipient is included in the To, CC, or BCC lines. However, Jira only accepts one specific address per Handler.

It'd be helpful to be able to select a catch rule based on the domain instead of a specific Mail address
fields.summary: Allow catch based on domain in the mail handler

fields.description:
Currently, it's not possible to set a default group when a user is created through the "Comments from emails" mail handler.

This would be useful for having email-based conversations in Jira without giving them frontend access and granting access to all registered Users.
fields.summary: Ability to set the default group for users created through the mail handler

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Users are unable to easily view a list of projects that they own or are a project lead on.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option/filter on the projects page to show projects you own or listed as a project lead.

h3. Why this is important
 
Some users work exclusively from projects they own and the only way for them to view those projects currently is to sort the list of projects by owner and search for their username in the list.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to view all projects I'm listed as a lead or owner on

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*

There is no option to attach files when closing (Wrap up and Close) the Issues.

 

*Suggested Solution:*

A feature that allow users to attach files when closing Issues.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Change parent for subtasks shows old parent link in the UI


h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a *Story A* and a *subtask S1*
# Create a *Story B* and a *subtask S2*
# Open the *subtask S2* > *Move* > Change parent to be the *Story A*

h3. Expected Results
The newly changed parent link is shown *(Story A)*

h3. Actual Results
The old parent link for the subtask S2 is shown in the the UI *(Story B)*
*  !change parent for subtask.png|thumbnail! 

 
h3. Notes
* the database shows the correct issue link
* the subtask is visible under the correct parent (the new parent)
* the subtask does not show under the old parent

h3.Workaround
-
fields.summary: Change Parent for subtask shows the old parent link in the UI

fields.description:
h3. Description

Currently, when editing a feature under the settings menu, the left panel will display the Dashboards menu instead of keeping the *Settings* editing area context. 

*E.g.:*

* Screens
* Workflows
* Custom fields
* Notification Schemes
* Permissions Schemes

This behavior is illustrated on the following video: 

* https://www.screencast.com/t/tj1dNSvdL

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the first Jira's Dashboard page go to the left navigation menu.
 # Click on 'Settings'
 # Then Click on 'Issues'
 # Choose one option. Eg. 'Screens'
 # On View Screens page, click 'Configure' next to any Screen listed to view the 'Configure Screen' page
 # Note that the navigation menu in the left panel is reset to the first stage(Dashboard) rather than stay in 'Screen' context.

h3. Actual Results

When accessing some of the options in the menu, after entering in the option, the menu is reset to the first stage (Dashboards) and with the current behaviour, the customer has to click Dashboards -->Settings --> Issues, every time in order to continue working on fields and issues.

h3. Expected Behavior

The left menu should stay on *Settings* context to make the navigation easier. 

h3. Workaround
Type '.' (dot) and type the area you want to access. Eg. 'Screens'
fields.summary: In the new JIRA UI, when editing features under the Settings -> Issues, the left menu context is changed to the Dashboards menu

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When editing an issue status using the "main status screen" (e.g. "gg" or "dot" then "statuses"), when you click "edit" in any status, it opens a screen which has a *?* icon next to the category of that status. This icon is forwarding administrators to a "Page not found" URL.

!Question mark icon.png|thumbnail!

h3. *Steps to reproduce*

1. Access [https://xxx.atlassian.net/secure/admin/EditStatus!default.jspa?id=1] where xxx is any Cloud instance

*Expected Results*

It’s expected that the *?* icon leads to a valid Knowledge Base.

*Actual Results*
The *?* icon leads to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ADMINJIRACLOUD/Defining+status+field+values], which gives us:

!Misleading URL.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround*

^-Not quite a workaround but-^

Editing the status on the workflow environment results in the edit status screens not showing the *?* icon next to the category, thus not forwarding the administrator to an incorrect URL
fields.summary: "Page not found" URL for the help icon on Edit Status screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After you change a sub-task's parent, its link won't change.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a sub-task in the issue *A*;
 # Select the sub-task;
 # Click on the elipses button -> *Move* -> *Change parent*;
 # Select the issue *B* as the new parent.

When you go to the issue *A*, the sub-task won't be there anymore. When you go to the issue *B*, the sub-task is there as expected.
But if you directly select the sub-task (by any path), you'll notice that the sub task link is still pointing to the issue *A*. (The link I'm referring to is the one in the red rectangle:  !Sub-task link.png|thumbnail! ).

h3. Expected Results
The link should change to *Project / Issue B / Sub-task* instead of being kept as *Project / Issue A / Sub-task*.

h3. Actual Results
The link will point to the previous parent: *Project / Issue A / Sub-task*.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no workaround.
fields.summary: Sub-task link won't change even after it's parent has been changed

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*
When creating a project using a shared configuration the Board is not configured in the created project.

*Suggested Solution:*
Allow the user to choose the Board the project will belong to.

*Workaround:*
Create a project and, after, configure the Board.
fields.summary: Select Board when creating project with shared configuration

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 11 June 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone, thanks again for the interest on this ticket. We’re marking this ticket as closed now because a workaround has been released to solve the issue of "users always being forced into the American format of mm/dd/yyyy" by allowing each user to format their dates and times on the new issue view based on their language preferences. For many of you, this workaround solved the problem. *(see details of workaround in May 24th update - it will be cross posed at bottom of this section as well)*

 

For those customers that still face challenges with this solution we have opened a new ticket JRACLOUD-76814 where we will gather interest specifically on when the user level language based settings is not a viable solution. Please comment on this new ticket to let us know your specific use case (i.e. why it’s important to have a specific date/time settings, and whether you’d like it at admin or user level), so we can ensure the experience we release works for you.

For those concerned about their calendar locking Sunday as the first day of the week, watch and comment on this ticket: JRACLOUD-71611

*Cross-post May 24th update on workaround*
 * Users can now change the *{color:#00875a}default edit and display of both date and date/time fields{color}*,{color:#00875a} *using their language/locale setup (i.e. "en_AUS" or "Dutch")*{color} instead of being forced into the American month/day/year display only. Here’s how to setup yours: [https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/manage-your-language-preferences/].
 * For those using language not supported (i.e. Greek). We suggest you choose UK English as your preference to get the desired display of day/month/year.

For those customers that still face challenges with this solution we have opened a new ticket where we will gather interest specifically on when the user level language based settings is not a viable solution. Please comment on this new ticket https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-76814 to let us know your specific use case (i.e. why it’s important to have a specific date/time settings, and whether you’d like it at admin or user level), so we can ensure the experience we release works for you.

For those concerned about their calendar locking Sunday as the first day of the week, watch and comment on this ticket: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71611 

*Appendix: Details on what's the mapping between language settings and date/time display*

||Swedish

The Atlassian Product Team
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24 May 2021}
Our research has shown that (1) significant portion of existing use cases for “date/time advanced settings” is to configure a date/time that makes sense for a specific location/country (2) cross geographic collaboration is a common and increasing use case that requires different date/time display between users within the same instance. To better adapt our product to this, we’ll progressively roll-out the following changes in upcoming days.
 * Users can now change the *default edit and display of both date and date/time fields*, *using their language/locale setup (i.e. "en_AUS" or "Dutch")* instead of being forced into the American month/day/year display only. Here’s how to setup yours: [https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/manage-your-language-preferences/]. For those using language not supported (i.e. Greek). We suggest you choose UK English as your preference to get the desired display of day/month/year.

 * As part of shifting such setting to the user level, in long term, we’ll remove the advanced admin setting of custom date/time format (which currently can be found under: System->User Interface->Look and feel->Date/time format). In the interim, warning message of “advanced date picker settings will no longer be supported” will appear.{panel}
h3.  
h3.  
h3. Unable to change the due date format in the pop-up view for Jira projects. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. In the Advanced Settings, change the date format to any format. (see below for format used in this example)

!Advanced_Settings_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

The due date should be in the format configured (dd.MM.yy)
h3. Actual Results

The due date remains in the same American format (yyyy-mm-dd)

!Jira_Import_Test_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

This problem also affects other features that use dates, such as the *Time Tracking* feature. When logging work, the date field also does not respect the settings applied:
 * Configuration:
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-01 at 2.02.20 PM.png|thumbnail!
 * Actual results:
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-01 at 2.02.07 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. This only happens in the backlog issue view screen. In the issue, details view the format is as configured. It also affects the ISO8601 standard in Date Picker (Sunday first day of the week instead of Monday).
h3. There is currently no workaround for this.
fields.summary: New Issue View does not respect Jira's Advanced Settings Date Format

fields.description:
h5. Description

Currently, it is possible to easily specify a translated name and description for each available language for all values of the following 'issue constants':

* the issue type field (for either standard and sub-task issue types)
* the status field
* the resolution field
* the priority field

But it's not possible to set this for workflow's transitions. 

h5. Actual Behavior
 
An administrator can't specify a translated name for their workflows' transitions that would display on their users own chosen language.

h5. Expected Behavior

Transitions could be treated as 'issue constants'. This would provide a JIRA administrator with the ability to specify translations for their workflows' transitions easily.
fields.summary: As a JIRA administrator, I would like to have workflow transitions added as 'issue constants' so they can be automatically translated based on user's chosen language

fields.description: Allow to use HTML in JIRA Cloud Fields
fields.summary: HTML support for JIRA Cloud Fields

fields.description: Oftentimes we provision new users into our company 2-3 weeks ahead and need some lead time when sending out software invitations.  I always have to wait until I am in a 7 day window to send the Atlassian Jira invites.  It would be great to expand this time frame out from 7 to 14 days at least.  Thank you!
fields.summary: Jira Invitations expire after 7 days - can we expand the timeframe?

fields.description:

When user A shares a filter or a search result with user B. User B receives the email from user A, instead of JIRA's outgoing email address (jira@<instance-name>.atlassian.net)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to issue navigator or browse any search filter
# Click on Share button (Share this search by emailing other users) 
!Fillter share button.png|thumbnail! 
# Enter an email address for "User name or email"
# Click *Share*

The user (who you shared the filter with) receives an email from JIRA's outgoing email address

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if Jira/Slack integration is configured to send messages when someone leaves a comment, all comments will trigger this event.
There is no way to add more specific conditions to trigger this event.
 !slack-settings.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the conditions to trigger messages in a Slack room for comments on issues. 
For example, only comments from specific users, or comments including a hashtag *#word* will trigger the notification in the Slack room.

h3. Why this is important
This is important because in certain cases users do not want that every comment on issue triggers a notification in the Slack.
 
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Improve the conditions which trigger messages on Slack rooms

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you have lots of saved filters going to the "Manage Filters" section can take a lot of time to load.

h3. Environment
 * JIRA 1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Manager Filters section
 # Considerably longer to load than the previous Jira UI version.

h3. Expected Results
* The page would load within a few seconds, there are cases where it takes more than a minute to load this page.

h3. Actual Results
 * Depending on the number of saved filters it will take several minutes to load the page.

h3. Workaround

None

h3. Note

Previously, this section would have a few sub-menu options and would not load all filters directly.

 !Screen Shot 2017-12-26 at 11.19.14 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Jira new UI presents poor performance for Manage filters section

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

 

The [Atlassian Cloud Documentation blog posts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2017/12] has stream of continuous updates on a weekly basis.
 - [Atlassian Cloud changes Nov 27 to Dec 4, 2017|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2017/12/atlassian-cloud-changes-nov-27-to-dec-4-2017]
 - [Atlassian Cloud changes Dec 4 to Dec 11, 2017|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2017/12/atlassian-cloud-changes-dec-4-to-dec-11-2017]
 - [Atlassian Cloud changes Dec 11 to Dec 18, 2017|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2017/12/atlassian-cloud-changes-dec-11-to-dec-18-2017]
 - [Atlassian Cloud changes Dec 18 to Dec 25, 2017|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2017/12/atlassian-cloud-changes-dec-18-to-dec-25-2017]

At a glance, all these updates look like duplicate of each other, it is hard to differentiate what are the key updates from one week to another, there are legends used to determine this but when scrolling it can be difficult to keep track of this from a user point of view.

Below is a direct feedback from a user:
{quote} - The star to plus ratio is incredible low. There should be a
 filtering/categorization feature made available for easier differentiation from one update to another.{quote}
h3. *Suggested Solution*
 * Redesign the updates on a weekly basis in a more user friendly and easy to read method.
 * Add a filtering/categorization feature made available for each of the update.

h3. *Why this is important*

Helps to be a better medium of information for the users to go through and help boost better understanding on the week to week changes being made and consistent roll-outs as well. Decrease the confusion, that the documentations are bugged and are showing duplicates instead of proper updates. Improve higher rate of users taking time to go through the updates and not getting tired doing a side by side comparison.
fields.summary: Improve the Readability and User Friendly Factor of the Atlassian Cloud Documentation blog post

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Jira admins need to enforce 2-factor authentication but with many external partners with Jira and Confluence, and they will never be able to control their email domains, but would still like to enforce two factor to our Atlassian cloud instance.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the possibility to use 2-factor authentication on all users (domains not claimed). 
Another solution could be to allow per instance multi factor authentication for the instance site admins
fields.summary: Enforcing 2 factor authentication without claiming domain

fields.description:
While creating custom field, it is not checked if field with same name already exist in default or custom field. This allow Admin to create duplicate field and causes confusion when that field is needed to be added in screen or reports, as which one to use.

Refer user feedback on this from community

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-discussions/JIRA-field-with-same-name-Duplicate-Field-names/td-p/693235]

 A feature is required that checks and stops Admin from creating such field.
fields.summary: Re Allowing Custom Field created with same name as existing default field or custom field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issue links can be duplicated if they are created on different screens.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create one issue A
# Go to *Edit* and create an issue link to an issue B
# Go to *...* > *Link* and create another link to the same issue B

h3. Expected Results
Jira should ignore the attempt of the second link as it already exists.

h3. Actual Results
Both links appear in the issue view:
 !duplicated-link.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
The problem is not reproducible if you go to *Edit*, create the issue link and try to repeat the process through the *Edit* screen.
The issue link is only duplicated if one of them is created through the *Edit* screen and the other through the *Link* screen.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Issue links can be duplicated if they are created on different screens

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The issue view doesn't load as expected if the description has two bullets in a row.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud with the *New Jira issue view*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable the *New Jira issue view*
# Create an issue with the following description: {panel}** Test{panel}
# Open a board that shows the issue and click on the issue

h3. Expected Results
Issue is loaded

h3. Actual Results
The issue is not loaded correctly.
Creating sub-tasks from the issue view keeps spinning and the operation is not concluded.
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Update the description
fields.summary: Jira detail view doesn't load description if it has two bullets in a row

fields.description:
h5. Description

When I'm on the backlog view of a project, there's no easy way to see the blue navigation menu without having to exit the backlog view and go back to the system dashboard using the *JIRA* icon on the top-left of my screen: 

 !jira button.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Actual Behavior
 
This is particularly difficult when trying to access add-ons or use filters. The *Manage filters* button is only available on the *blue menu*:

 !blue menu.png|thumbnail! 

While the *grey menu* don't have this option available: 

 !grey menu.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Expected Behavior

I'd like to have an easy way to open the blue navigation menu from anywhere in my JIRA instance.
fields.summary: As a user, I found difficult to switch from the grey navigation bar to the blue navigation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Having an issue with a description field where another user mentioned your user as an update of the field, when you later try to clone the issue, since the description field will be cloned, all its content will be cloned, you will get notified by email that you mentioned yourself in an issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an issue with a description field.
 2. Another user updates the description field and mentions your user as part of the update. (you can get notified that an update was made in the issue, this is not our case study here)
 3. When you try to clone an issue. 
 4. When your profile is configured to not receive changes you make. (This step is very important otherwise the behaviour won't be replicated)
 5. You will not receive an email telling you that the new issue let's call it *"clone - Issue"* was created. 
 6. However you will receive an email telling you that you mentioned yourself in an issue. (which is not true because another user originally mentioned you)
h3. Notes
 * this only happens if the configuration in your profile is *to not notify you of your own changes*
 * If the *notify you of your own changes* is activated, when you clone the issue, you will receive one email telling you that an issue was created.

h3. Workaround
 * When the *notify you of your own changes* is activated in the profile config you receive accurate email notifications, this may be considered a workaround.
fields.summary: Cloning an issue that contains a user mention in the description field generates an inaccurate email notification

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to import an attachment within the csv file import feature, and setting the Attachment column with a link to a public Google Drive repository, Jira creates an invalid attachment because it won't analyse the link correctly.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create (or export issues) a valid csv to import it into Jira;
 # In the Attachment cell, paste the link from the file in the repository;
 # Import the csv file into Jira;
 # Check the created issue.

h3. Expected Results

The attachment should be created correctly.

h3. Actual Results
Jira creates an attachment, but it is invalid. For example, the link https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=1iOSSvoRK0puMmTF5NiMAPLOGcPCP0VJB should create a downloadable csv file. But it creates a file named *uc* (because Jira fecthes it in the link), and it downloads the file without extension.

h3. Workaround

I have configured dropbox folder and enabled the feature to have people access it with the valid link generated. Setting the link https://www.dropbox.com/home/Kappa/test.csv in the Attachment cell in the csv file, will result in Jira being able to analyse it, thus, enabling the expected behaviour towards attachments (in this case, Jira will download the file with the .csv format).
fields.summary: JIRA won't behave properly with google drive linked attachments imported from csv

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

Organization admins are able to:
 * Change the account name 
 * Change the account's email address
 * Disable the account, so the user can no longer access any sites or log in to their account. 
 * Require a password reset for a particular user, or for all users.
 * Temporarily exclude an account from two-step verification. For example, if the user is unable to log in because they've lost their phone.

Organization admins are not able to set/change the password manually anymore.  
h3. Suggested Solution

 Organization admins should be able to quickly set/change the password manually.
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability for organization admins to set password

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Issue Statistics gadget shows 'No priority' and 'Irrelevant' as priorities when there's an issue with the Priority field hidden in its field configuration. 

The problem is that both 'No priority' and 'Irrelevant' shows the same number of issues in *Count* column, in other words, the information appears duplicated in the gadget.

 !Screen Shot 2017-12-21 at 5.31.59 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Also, if you click on the number of issues under Count 'column' for 'Irrelevant', you'll see a 404 error page.

 !Screen Shot 2017-12-21 at 5.32.11 PM.png|thumbnail! 

And if you click on the number of issues under Count 'column' for 'No priority' it will redirect you to a JQL for issues with priority empty, but it does not feat this case since the priority field is actually hidden.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a filter with issues in which the priority field is hidden in their field configuration
# Create a dashboard
# Add the Issue Statistics gadget
# Select the filter and select *Priority* in *Statistic Type*

h3. Expected Results

The gadget should count the number of issues with the field priority hidden only as 'No priority' or only as 'Irrelevant' and the links to show the hidden issues should be removed since they are not redirecting to a page with the correct information of which issues are hidden.

h3. Actual Results

# The gadget shows the same number of issues with the priority hidden twice: as 'No priority' and 'Irrelevant'. 
# If you check the number of issues that the selected filter has, you'll see that the gadget sums the number of issues in Irrelevant to the number of issues retrieved by the filter. Using the screenshot above as an example, the gadget is showing 53 as the total of issues, but the filter has only 52 issues.
# When you click on the number of issues under Count 'column' for 'No priority' it will open a JQL searching for issues where the priority is empty and it will show no results since the priority of the issues shown in 'No priority' is not really empty, it's hidden.
# When you click on the number of issues under Count 'column' for 'Irrelevant', you'll see a 404 error page.

h3.Workaround

No workarounds.
fields.summary: Issue Statistics gadget shows duplicate results in 'No priority' and 'Irrelevant'

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users with no "Browse Projects" permission are being listed in the autocomplete list when being mentioned in comment through Jira mobile app
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure user A does not have "Browse Projects" permission in the project ABC
 # Login to the instance using Jira mobile application as a different user (user B). This user should have all the permissions to mention users (Browse users global permission, browse projects, etc.)
 # Try to mention user A by typing username, a list of users with similar username will popup

h3. Notes
 * Although impermissible users can be mentioned in the issue, JIRA *will not* send email notification to those users
 * Issues can't be assigned to the impermissible users (they won't be listed in issue's assignee field)

h3. Expected Results

Only users with "Browse Projects" permission are being displayed in the autocomplete list
h3. Actual Results

Users who are not granted with the "Browse Projects" permission are shown in the autocomplete list
fields.summary: Users without "Browse Projects" permission are being listed in autocomplete list when mentioning using Jira mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Wildcard searches using number is working inconsistently with the new Jira Experience

_*How it works in the old UI*_
# Go to *Project* ABC
# Search for number > type a number that is from an issue key in this project, example 123
# *Enter*

*Result*:  issue ABC-123 is open


h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start using the [Introducing your new Jira experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/introducing-your-new-jira-experience-937886012.html]
# Go to the project ABC
# Have an example issue with a key ABC-123
# Use the magnifying glass to search for 123

h3. Expected Results
Issue is found in the resilts

h3. Actual Results
If this number is used in a text field in any issue on the instance, the first issue in the results gets open

If not, (if this number is not used in a text field in any issue on the instance), the issue navigator show *Last viewed issues* query:
{code}
ORDER BY lastViewed DESC
{code}
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
# Turn off the new UI from *Profile* > *Turn off for now*
fields.summary: Wildcard searches using number is working inconsistently in the new Jira Experience

fields.description: Atlassian Cloud should support the ability to take profile information/data from external sources, so that they aren't dependent on the configuration set within https://id.atlassian.com
fields.summary: Allow for the ability to take profile information from external sources

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you move one subtask from one parent to another, there are certain inconsistencies after that.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create one issue and create one or more sub-tasks under it.
# Try to move the sub-task to another parent.

h3. Expected Results
- The issue is moved, and the sub-task stats to reference the new parent.

h3. Actual Results
- The issue is moved, and the reference is correct in the *Sub-tasks* section of the issue. However, the path references the old parent in the breadcrumbs
-  Parent view before moving the sub-task(which is correct):
 !first-parent.png|thumbnail! 
- View of the second parent, after moving the subtask:
 !second-parent.png|thumbnail! 
- Sub-task view, with the incorrect breadcrumb:
 !subtask-view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
- Verified the jiraissue table - already existing issues had the column *effective_subtask_parent_id* as null.
Newly created issues have this column populated with the issue id.
- Once created, the sub-task have the columns *denormalised_subtask_parent*, *subtask_parent_id* and *effective_subtask_parent_id* properly populated. However, once the issue is moved to the new parent, only the *denormalised_subtask_parent* is properly updated.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: The breadcrumbs are incorrectly displayed in the issue view once a sub-task is moved to a new parent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*Update:*

This bug is a duplicate of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-69225. Please follow along with JRACLOUD-69225 for further updates.
 {panel}
 

h3. Summary

While regular Jira issue links are shown on the new Jira issue view (enabled/disabled on the user's profile), Confluence pages are not. It's also not possible to link issues from this view either, though it was possible on the original issue detail view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable *New Jira issue view* on {{secure/ViewProfile.jspa}}
 # Link a Confluence page to a Jira issue
 # Under _Active Sprints_, click on the card corresponding to the issue you added the Conf page to.

h3. Expected Results

The Confluence page is shown as linked to the issue.
h3. Actual Results

The Confluence is now shown as linked to the issue. See images below:
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-21 at 6.33.41 PM.png|thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2017-12-21 at 6.35.48 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Disable new Jira issue view on your profile within the instance. You profile can be accessed at:
 - https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa
fields.summary: Linked Confluence pages are not shown on the new Jira issue view

fields.description: In the new UI when you click Reports it loads the main reports page AND the submenu. When you click Issues it only loads the submenu. I don't like having two clicks to get to my issues.  Please make this behavior the same.
fields.summary: Make "issues" menu behave like "Reports" menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Smart query is not working on the new Jira UI (ADG3)
h3. Environment
 * Tested on Jira 2a86cec2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # go to search
 # type "my done"
 # Select view Matching Issues 

h3. Expected Results

The below query should be inserted in the search:
{noformat}
status = Done AND assignee in currentUser() order by lastViewed DESC
{noformat}
h3. Actual Results

The below query is inserted in the search:
{noformat}
summary ~ "my done*" OR description ~ "my done*" ORDER BY lastViewed DESC
{noformat}
h3. Notes

Switching from "new-jira-experience" back to old - smart query works again
h3. Workaround

Use basic or advanced search
fields.summary: Smart query is not working on the new Jira UI

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Issue Type icons are not loading in the create issue screen in the new Jira UI

 # Fill up with the 'Project' and 'Issue Type'
 # Click 'Next'
 # See the error on the next screen, where the Issue Type does not load

Issue Type Icon loading properly
h2. Actual Results

Issue Type Icon not loading

!Screen Shot 2017-12-21 at 1.31.44 PM.png|thumbnail!

None
fields.summary: Issue Type icons are not loading in the create issue screen in the new Jira UI

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  
The administrator has the possibility to set an announcement banner (example.atlassian.net/secure/admin/EditAnnouncementBanner.jspa) with important messages which will be visible to all the users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Every user should have the option to set an announcement banner to publish a message. The published message could be sent to the users via email (registered on the platform).

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability for all the users to publish important messages using announcement banners

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using Chrome in the backlog view of a project in the new Jira experience is severely slow, especially to scroll down.

h3. Environment
 * JIRA 1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a project with a considerable amount of issues.
# Access the backlog view (or any boards with lots of issues) for that project using Chrome
# Try to scroll down using the mouse wheel or the two-fingered gesture in Mac
 

h3. Expected Results
 * The scroll down would happen smoothly

h3. Actual Results
 * Scroll down is unbearably slow when using Chrome or not even working.


h3. Workaround

 # Use Firefox or Safari as these browsers are behaving normally in this view.

h3. Note

# If possible changing the filter of the board (backlog) could mitigate the problem.
Suggestion: Add {{and status not in ("Closed","Resolved") and {{resolution is empty}} to the filter.
fields.summary: Scrolling down in the backlog view using Chrome in the new UI is not working or severely slow

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Editing/Changing a custom field's description will not get updated in the create/view/edit screen.

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Create a custom field with description
# Edit the description
# Create/edit issue with this custom field, the description is not updated.

h2. Expected Result
The description of the field should be updated

h2. Current Result
The description of the field is not updated
fields.summary: Description of a field doesn't get updated when changed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently with the *New Jira issue view* Labs feature enabled, when an issue is opened and a user copies the link to the board, opening this link in another tab does not show the issue details. 


h3. Suggested Solution
The customer would like to have the selected issue should open up when loading the board with a selected issue in the link:
*  !new jira view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround 
Disable the *New Jira issue view* Labs feature from your *Profile* Page. 
*  !Issue Details View.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Selected issue should open up when loading the board with a selected issue in the link

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
- retrieve value from REST: /rest/api/2/mypreferences?key=user.issues.per.page
- navigate to /jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa, change "Page size" to something else
- now the rest api is broken

This is because the rest API accesses the value as string, while it's actually saved as long.
fields.summary: Numeric user preference breaks after being updated from UI
